theme.name: Theme
theme.summary: Use this oracle to generate an abstract noun that, if matched with the [Action](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/core/action) oracle, provides an interpretative answer to most questions.

rows.text: Partially constructed / The host planet is a rocky world (no atmosphere, mono biome: bleak; page 72). The lack of an active core has prevented a magnetic field from forming; the world has the additional feature of having a highly irradiated surface as solar winds bombard the world with powerful radiation while stripping away any atmosphere and hydrosphere.

Operational / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate its  features, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Furnace  World", "Jovian World", "Rocky World", and "Shattered World" Planetary Class results. The  world must have at least a thin atmosphere.

Non-functional or offline / As operational. However, the world's core has  begun cooling. Reduced effectiveness of the  magnetic field has gradually allowed more radiation to reach the planet's surface, making the world mildly irradiated.

Dysfunctional / As non-functional or offline, but holes within the magnetic field have allowed certain regions  of the world's surface to be bombarded by powerful, radioactive winds, resulting in highly irradiated regions and powerful earthquakes.

Destroyed / The planet is a rocky world (no atmosphere,  mono biome: bleak; page 72). The loss of its  active core has caused its magnetic field to dissipate, allowing solar winds to bombard the world with powerful radiation and strip away any atmosphere and hydrosphere.
Broaden scope of the faction to include a new focus
Build or secure a powerful device
Consolidate control of a valuable commodity
Disrupt the operations of a rival
Escape the control of another faction or power
Establish a safe refuge or headquarters
Expand operations to a new location or sector
Obtain incriminating information about a rival
Put down an internal revolt or rebellion
Rescue or recover a group or asset
Resolve a conflict with another faction
Reunite splintered elements of the faction
Seize a powerful artifact or valuable treasure
Usurp leadership within a rival faction
Partially constructed / The planet is a furnace world (mono biome: volcanic; page 52).

Operational / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the megastructure, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Furnace World", "Jovian "World", and "Shattered World" Planetary Class results. There are no volcanoes, earthquakes, or magnetic disturbances.

Non-functional or offline / The planet is a furnace world (mono biome: volcanic; page 52). Making the geothermal stabilizer functional will have a quickly appearing effect on the world; all volcanic activity and earthquakes cease and any magnetic disturbances disappear. The planetary class (or biome) begins to change. For example, a furnace world will change into a rocky world as eruptions cease and previously exposed lava solidifies
Dysfunctional / As non-functional or offline, but the world also has these additional, perpetual features: * Erratic magnetic field * Powerful volcanic eruptions * Catastrophic earthquakes
Destroyed / The core is violently destabilized. The planet is a shattered world (page 74).

gigatransporter_vessel_platform_core.name: Gigatransporter Vessel Platform Core
gigatransporter_vessel_platform_core.summary:
Use the following tables to determine the composition of the vessel of the gigatransporter. In addition to these, you may use the Shape oracle on page 102 to further detail it.

If the gigatransporter is a space elevator, Ask the Oracle (small chance) if it has an energy-based beam as a way of transfer instead of the traditional vessel. An energy-based beam does not feature Vessel Levels or Travel Duration, as the beam extends between the surface and orbital stations and provides near-instantaneous travel.

action.name: Action
action.summary: Use this oracle to generate a verb that, if matched with the [Theme](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/core/theme) oracle, provides a prompt that can answer any goal, situation, or event.

descriptor.name: Descriptor
descriptor.summary: Use this oracle to generate an adjective that, if matched with the [Focus](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/core/focus) oracle, provides detail of a location, discovery, or encounter.

orbital_feature.name: Orbital Feature
orbital_feature.summary: Use this oracle to determine any orbiting features around a planet. For orbital settlements, use the Settlement table in the corresponding world oracle.

crystalline_world_crystal_rarity.name: Crystalline World Crystal Rarity
crystalline_world_crystal_rarity.summary:
Use the table below to generate crystals. Roll once to determine which crystal rarity column to reference. Then, roll again to uncover the crystal type result. The exotic table provides descriptors for incredibly rare minerals; roll up to twice when referencing said column.

If you are using the Space Sightings Expanded supplement by Ludic Pen, you can roll on these tables to generate the minerals of Debris Fields if they are made of crystals.

tidally_locked_world_central_band_five_b.name: Tidally-Locked World Central Band - Five Between Classes
tidally_locked_world_central_band_five_b.summary: On the Dark Side column of the Bands oracle, tally the number of worlds between the planetary classes rolled for the light and dark sides of the planet. Then, use that amount to determine which column to reference on the following table to define the planetary class of the central band. If there is only one world in between, envision it as the planetary class of the central band.

medium_planet_size_density_gravity.name: Medium Planet Size Density/Gravity
medium_planet_size_density_gravity.summary:
Use this oracle to define the main attributes of a planetary body. Once you roll for the world size, roll its density to determine the gravity.

Gravities

  * None: This celestial body has no gravity. Mechanical aids are required to traverse its environment.
  * Little: Gravitational forces are so feeble that they cannot provide consistent traction. Mechanical aids are recommended.
  * Weak: With enough caution and consideration, greatly reduced gravitational forces allow for major freedom of movement.
  * Low: Reduced gravity allows for significant maneuverability.
  * Ideal: Gravitational forces are at the levels to which humans naturally evolved to thrive.
  * High: Human survival can only be maintained for short durations without mechanical aids.
  * Severe:Explorers are unable to survive this level of gravity without the assistance of mechanical aids.

living_world_periosteum.name: Living World Periosteum
living_world_periosteum.summary:
Living worlds consist of two biomes: the epidermis and the periosteum. When you start your expedition into this world, Ask the Oracle (likely) if your exploration begins in the epidermis.

Thin layer immediately juxtaposed with osseous tissues.

rows.text: Curtains or blankets of connective tissue

A planet in the 1st proximity is the one in the nearest orbit to the stellar object, whereas the planet in the 2nd or higher proximity is the one in a farther orbit.

three_free_interplanetary_orbits.name: Three Free Interplanetary Orbits
three_free_interplanetary_orbits.summary:
Use this oracle to determine the placement of an asteroid belt around its star. To use it...

  * Calculate the number of orbits that are currently free - in which no asteroid belt or megastructure has been marked - and reference the corresponding column.
  * Mark the asteroid belt in the resulting free interplanetary orbit. These are numbered as per their proximity to the stellar object--the 1st being the closest one.
  * Shift one column to the right as the number of free interplanetary orbits changes and there are asteroid belts left to place.

If there is only one world in between, envision it as the planetary class of the central band.

five_free_planetary_orbits.name: Five Free Planetary Orbits
five_free_planetary_orbits.summary:
Use this oracle to determine the placement of a planet around its stellar object. To use it...

  * Calculate the number of orbits that are currently free--in which no planet or megastructure has been marked - and reference the corresponding column.
  * Mark the planet in the resulting free planetary orbit. These are numbered as per their proximity to the stellar object - the 1st being the closest one.
  * Shift one column to the right as the number of free planetary orbits changes and there are planets left to place.

massive_planet_size_density_gravity.name: Massive Planet Size Density/Gravity
massive_planet_size_density_gravity.summary:
Use this oracle to define the main attributes of a planetary body. Once you roll for the world size, roll its density to determine the gravity.

Gravities

  * None: This celestial body has no gravity. Mechanical aids are required to traverse its environment.
  * Little: Gravitational forces are so feeble that they cannot provide consistent traction. Mechanical aids are recommended.
  * Weak: With enough caution and consideration, greatly reduced gravitational forces allow for major freedom of movement.
  * Low: Reduced gravity allows for significant maneuverability.
  * Ideal: Gravitational forces are at the levels to which humans naturally evolved to thrive.
  * High: Human survival can only be maintained for short durations without mechanical aids.
  * Severe:Explorers are unable to survive this level of gravity without the assistance of mechanical aids.

tidally_locked_world_names.name: Tidally-Locked World Names
tidally_locked_world_names.summary: A planet whose rotation is synchronous with its orbital period, creating eternal daylight, darkness, and twilight.

metallic_world_metal_type_exotic.name: Metallic World Metal Type - Exotic
metallic_world_metal_type_exotic.summary:
To identify a metal type, Ask the Oracle (50/50) if the metal is ferrous. If it is not, reference the appropriate column of the table below. Then, roll again to uncover the metal type result. The exotic column provides descriptors for incredibly rare metals; roll up to twice when referencing said column.

If you are using the Space Sightings Expanded supplement published by Ludic Pen, you can roll on these tables to generate the minerals of debris fields if they are made of metals.

large_planet_moon_size_gravity.name: Large Planet: Moon Size / Gravity
large_planet_moon_size_gravity.summary:
A moon is always smaller than the planetary body it orbits, so the moon size results are not equivalent of the planet size results. 

Once you roll for the moon size, cross-reference it with the planetary body size to determine the moon base gravity. Then, roll the density to determine the gravity modifier.

When you reach a waypoint while exploring a planet, use the table below to provide an event, encounter, or moment of character focus. 

If you get the "Planetside community" result but have previously determined there are no settlements in the world, reroll or envision how this contradiction adds an unexpected revelation.

rows.text: Terrain feature (choose one) 1. Surface Feature; planetary class page 2. Region Landmark; SI, pg 151 3.Underwater Feature; pg 31
Planetside community [Settlement](datasworn:oracle_collection:starforged/settlement); RG, pg 54 or SI, pg 164

vast_planet_moon_size_gravity.name: Vast Planet: Moon Size / Gravity
vast_planet_moon_size_gravity.summary:
A moon is always smaller than the planetary body it orbits, so the moon size results are not equivalent of the planet size results. 

Once you roll for the moon size, cross-reference it with the planetary body size to determine the moon base gravity. Then, roll the density to determine the gravity modifier.

living_world_cursed_lurking_threat.name: Living World Cursed Lurking Threat
living_world_cursed_lurking_threat.summary:
Threat / When the clock advances... / When the clock is filled...

The interior of a living world is horribly inhospitable; you are the foreign organism that must be exterminated. To represent this growing danger, add a tension clock. When you suffer a cost through failure, delay, or inaction, you may advance the clock to show the threat drawing closer. This table offers inspiration for these scenarios, including what signs you encounter as the tension clock advances, and what occurs when the clock fills.

To learn more about tension clocks, see page 238 of the Starforged rulebook.

rows.text: Great bacteria / Territorial markings; signs or sounds of the creature / The bacteria strikes!
Infesting lifeforms / Skitterings and chitterings; grotesque nests / Swarms of vile lifeforms attack!
Major antibody agent / Surfaces contract for protection; hardening walls / A great antibody appears!
Roaming virus / Rolling, foul fog; surfaces react abruptly / Your body gets ill!
Strong immune response / Toxic ambience; dizzying passages / Your body breaks down!

titanic_planet_size_density_gravity.name: Titanic Planet Size Density/Gravity
titanic_planet_size_density_gravity.summary:
Use this oracle to define the main attributes of a planetary body. Once you roll for the world size, roll its density to determine the gravity.

Gravities

  * None: This celestial body has no gravity. Mechanical aids are required to traverse its environment.
  * Little: Gravitational forces are so feeble that they cannot provide consistent traction. Mechanical aids are recommended.
  * Weak: With enough caution and consideration, greatly reduced gravitational forces allow for major freedom of movement.
  * Low: Reduced gravity allows for significant maneuverability.
  * Ideal: Gravitational forces are at the levels to which humans naturally evolved to thrive.
  * High: Human survival can only be maintained for short durations without mechanical aids.
  * Severe:Explorers are unable to survive this level of gravity without the assistance of mechanical aids.

living_world_nucleus.name: Living World Nucleus
living_world_nucleus.summary:
The nucleus of the living world is one of the focal points of this vast organism. If you are on an expedition without a specific mission, these areas can serve as your destination. Use the table below to reveal what vital organ lies there.

If you interact with a nucleus, envision how the world is affected by it. If a vital organ ends up damaged, how does the whole organism suffer? If this affectation constitutes the death of the planet, how does it manifest? What is a necrotic living world like and how do other organisms survive this environmental change?

two_free_planetary_orbits.name: Two Free Planetary Orbits
two_free_planetary_orbits.summary:
Use this oracle to determine the placement of a planet around its stellar object. To use it...

  * Calculate the number of orbits that are currently free--in which no planet or megastructure has been marked - and reference the corresponding column.
  * Mark the planet in the resulting free planetary orbit. These are numbered as per their proximity to the stellar object - the 1st being the closest one.
  * Shift one column to the right as the number of free planetary orbits changes and there are planets left to place.

The exotic column provides descriptors for incredibly rare metals; roll up to twice when referencing said column.

If you are using the Space Sightings Expanded supplement published by Ludic Pen, you can roll on these tables to generate the minerals of debris fields if they are made of metals.

celestial_harvesters_star_lifter_stellar.name: Celestial Harvesters Star Lifter Stellar Hazard
celestial_harvesters_star_lifter_stellar.summary: When you are in a sector containing an operational - or dysfunctional - star lifter, set a ten-segment tension clock. Once all segments are filled, the star lifter has drawn away enough of the star's mass that it creates a temporary, system-spanning hazard. Use the table below to identify it.

ecosphere_environment_starforged.name: Ecosphere Environment - Starforged
ecosphere_environment_starforged.summary: Use this oracle to determine the internal habitat of an ecosphere.

stellar_compressor_when_discovered_solar.summary: Mark the megastructure at the position of the stellar object. When rolling to determine the number of planets roll on the table below.

major_splinter_bonus.name: Major Splinter Bonus
major_splinter_bonus.summary: When using this oracle to reveal the effect of a major splinter bonus, take note of the result by marking it on the SPLINTER card. Then, reference this table when using it. Alternatively, you can write the bonus in the card abbreviately, or combine both styles.

rows.text: Add +1. On a miss, reroll any challenge dice. On a strong hit, take +1 momentum.
Add +1. You may reroll any challenge dice. On a hit, take +2 momentum.
Add +1. You may reroll any challenge dice. On a strong hit, add +1 on your next move.
Add +2. On a miss, reroll one challenge die. On a hit, take +1 momentum.
Add +2. On a miss, reroll one challenge die. On a strong hit, take +2 momentum.
Add +2. On a strong hit, take +3 momentum and add +2 on your next move.
Add +3. On a hit, add +1 on your next move. On a strong hit, take +2 momentum.
Add +3. On a hit, take +1 momentum and add +1 on your next move.
Add +3. On a strong hit, take +3 momentum and add +1 on your next move.
Count a miss as a weak hit. Then, add +1 on your next move.
Count a miss as a weak hit. Then, take +3 momentum.
Count a weak hit as a strong hit. Then, add +1 on your next move.
Count a weak hit as a strong hit. Then, take +3 momentum.
Lose Momentum (-1). Then, take an automatic strong hit, but still roll your action.
Lose Momentum (-2). Then, choose one: Count a miss a weak hit or count a weak hit as a strong hit.
On a miss, reroll any challenge dice. On a hit, add +2 on your next move.
On a miss, reroll any challenge dice. On a hit, add +2 on your next move. On a strong hit, take +1 momentum.
On a miss, reroll any challenge dice. On a hit, take +3 momentum and add +1 on your next move.
On a miss, reroll one challenge die. On a hit, add +2 on your next move. On a strong hit, take +3 momentum
On a miss, reroll one challenge die. On a hit, take +2 momentum. On a strong hit, add +2 on your next move.
Roll an extra challenge die and keep the two lowest. On a hit, add +1 on your next move. On a strong hit, take +2 momentum.
Roll an extra challenge die and keep the two lowest. On a hit, take +1 momentum and add +1 on your next move.
Roll an extra challenge die and keep the two lowest. On a strong hit, take +3 momentum and add +1 on your next move.
Take an automatic strong hit, but still roll your action. Then, Lose Momentum (-1).
Take an automatic strong hit, but still roll your action. Then, make a suffer move (-2).
You may reroll any challenge dice. On a hit, take +3 momentum. On a strong hit, add +1 on your next move.
You may reroll any challenge dice. On a strong hit, add +2 on your next move.
You may reroll one challenge die. On a hit, add +2 on your next move. On a strong hit, take +2 momentum.
You may reroll one challenge die. On a hit, take +1 momentum and add +2 on your next move.
You may reroll one challenge die. On a strong hit, take +3 momentum and add +2 on your next move.

Roll twice and take both bonuses with two different focuses. If you decide to use the SPLINTER's power, choose which focus to use and which bonus to take. Discard the SPLINTER when you roll a 5 or 6 on your action die (instead of a 6) after resolving the move.

celestial_brains_asking_questions_when_u.name: Celestial Brains Asking Questions - When - Undetermined Continuity
celestial_brains_asking_questions_when_u.summary:
Use this oracle if you want to determine when an event occurs. If you already know that an event happened in the past or future, reference the Determined Continuity column. Otherwise, reference the Undetermined Continuity column.

There are "when" questions that this oracle might not be suitable for answering, such as "When did the precursor civilizations fall" or "When will the universe end". In such cases, you may still use the oracle below solely for vaguely past or future answers but not specific time scales.

celestial_brains_asking_questions_region.name: Celestial Brains Asking Questions - Region
celestial_brains_asking_questions_region.summary: Use this oracle to broadly determine the "where" answer provided by a brain.

celestial_brains_sentience_matrioshka.name: Celestial Brains Sentience - Matrioshka
celestial_brains_sentience_matrioshka.summary: Some brains may have gained a high level of sentience by design, error, or synthetic evolution. When interacting with one of these constructs, roll on the table below to determine its overall intelligence.

celestial_brains_sentience_jupiter.name: Celestial Brains Sentience - Jupiter
celestial_brains_sentience_jupiter.summary: Some brains may have gained a high level of sentience by design, error, or synthetic evolution. When interacting with one of these constructs, roll on the table below to determine its overall intelligence.

rows.text: Commanding keeper / What is the nature of the overseeing construct that guards this  site?
Confined being / What entity or creature is imprisoned in this place?
Cursed relic / What treasure or splinter of the past is held here?
Eldritch sect / What corrupted faction made this site their place of operation?
Enigmatic gateway / What strange domain does this site connect to?
Haunting anomaly / What aberration makes its presence felt in this place?
Menacing portent / What foreboding catastrophe does this site hold?
Ruinous fallout / What calamity left this place bound to everlasting decay?
Weird mutation / What physical or mental alteration can this site cause?
Wretched technology / What abnormal machinery or apparatus affects this site?

celestial_brains_asking_questions_when_d.name: Celestial Brains Asking Questions - When - Determined Continuity
celestial_brains_asking_questions_when_d.summary:
Use this oracle if you want to determine when an event occurs. If you already know that an event happened in the past or future, reference the Determined Continuity column. Otherwise, reference the Undetermined Continuity column.

There are "when" questions that this oracle might not be suitable for answering, such as "When did the precursor civilizations fall" or "When will the universe end". In such cases, you may still use the oracle below solely for vaguely past or future answers but not specific time scales.

rows.text: Ancient relic / What alien artifact or treasure can be found here?
Biological constitution / What were the species that inhabited this place?
Civilizational purpose / What was the overall function of this city for its species?
Cryptic waymaker / What greater location or finding does this site lead to?
Enemy plot / What objective does a foe or rival have in this site?
Lost inhabitant / What was the destiny of the people who originally lived here?
Political system / What was the form of government which ruled this settlement?
Popular faith / What was the most widespread belief in this place?
Social structure / What was the collective arrangement of the people who lived here?
Traditional practices / What important cultural customs were practiced here?
Unfinished project / What abandoned program left its shadow in this site?
Valuable resource / What stock of goods or materials can be found here?

unidentified_megastructure_ceramic_rarit.name: Unidentified Megastructure Ceramic Rarity
unidentified_megastructure_ceramic_rarit.summary: Use the table below to reveal the type of ceramic and detail an object or environment. Roll once to determine which ceramic rarity column to reference. Then, roll again to uncover the ceramic type result.

sentinel_belt_stellar_megastructure_mega.name: Sentinel Belt Stellar Megastructure (Megastructure/Stellar Object)
sentinel_belt_stellar_megastructure_mega.summary: Use this table according to the When Discovered rules to reveal the stellar megastructure at the center of the sentinel belt.

rows.text: Dyson Object (if it is a Dyson Ring or Shell, it extends up to the 4th interplanetary orbit) / Star

quantity_of_megastructures_type_1.name: Quantity Of Megastructures - Type 1
quantity_of_megastructures_type_1.summary:
The default assumption for most megastructures is that only one may exist in any individual sector or solar system. This doesn't count for gigatransporters, which can be present without quantity restriction by inhabiting worlds or the greater megastructures enlisted in this section.

If you wish to include more megastructures in your setting, use the following guidelines. This assumes that your Megastructure Prevalence truth is that these marvels greet explorers and travelers with regularity. You determine your megastructure truths on page 87.

In a solar system confirmed to contain a megastructure, roll on the following table and reference the column that corresponds with your previously established truth about the precursor technological scale.

After determining the total megastructures present in a sector or solar system, roll >Megastructure Class (next page) to determine their types. When doing so, keep in mind that only one type 3 megastructure may exist in any individual solar system. If one is discovered, any subsequent rolls must be made referencing the Type 2 column.

unidentified_megastructure_when_discover.name: Unidentified Megastructure When Discovered Sector Based
unidentified_megastructure_when_discover.summary: Sub-planetary scale -- First, roll on the following table to determine the megastructure location.

megastructure_status.name: Megastructure Status
megastructure_status.summary: Use this oracle to identify the current condition of a megastructure. Some of these marvels are made up of many individual structures. In those cases, you may roll on this table to determine the status of any individual assemblies instead of the whole megastructure. Additionally, you may Ask the Oracle to determine whether the megastructure or assembly is visibly damaged. If yes, you may interpret the status result as a consequence of the damage.

rows.text: Partially constructed - The megastructure never reached a point of completion and was never operable
Operational - The megastructure appears to be fulfilling its original purpose as intended
Non-functional / offline - While still intact, the megastructure is either no longer functional or is offline
Dysfunctional - The megastructure is not functioning as originally intended
Destroyed - The megastructure has been wrecked

terraformer_hub_megastructure_status_non.name: Terraformer Hub Megastructure Status - Non-functional
terraformer_hub_megastructure_status_non.summary: The megastructure affects its host world in one of the following ways

rows.text: As operational, but roll >Altered Planetary Class twice (next page). The second result is the world's original class.
As if the terraformer hub were partially constructed.

megastructure_outer_first_look.name: Megastructure Outer First Look
megastructure_outer_first_look.summary: This oracle provides inspiration for the initial survey of a megastructure. It covers the aspects of the site that are obvious when observed at a distance.

unidentified_megastructure_type_type_2_c.name: Unidentified Megastructure Type - Type 2 civilizations
unidentified_megastructure_type_type_2_c.summary: Use this table only if your established truth is that the precursor technological scale was type 2 or 3. If this is the case, reference the appropriate column. Otherwise, assume the result to be 1.

atmosphere_harvester_megastructure_statu.name: Atmosphere Harvester Megastructure Status (Status / Effect)
atmosphere_harvester_megastructure_statu.summary: A cloud-roaming structure that siphons  off a world's atmosphere.

rows.text: Partially constructed / The megastructure's skeleton drifts amongst the worlds clouds, awaiting completion. The host planet is a Jovian world (page 58).
Operational / A vast column of gases is easily visible in the Jovian world that hosts the megastructure (page 58). This column violently churns while being drawn into the atmosphere harvester.

Non-functional or offline / Ask the Oracle (50/50) if the atmosphere harvester has completely siphoned the world's atmosphere. *  If yes: The megastructure left only the world's solid core. When you generate the Jovian world that serves as a host to the megastructure, use the Surface Biome guideline (page 59). The world has no atmosphere, nor does it have any features that are related to atmospheric weather. * If no: The atmosphere harvester is eerily still as it hovers among the Jovian world's clouds.

Dysfunctional / The atmosphere harvester is siphoning the Jovian world's gases at such a terrific rate that it has generated an enormous superstorm with the megastructure at its heart. The world has the additional feature of having a perpetual superstorm.
Destroyed / The remains of the atmosphere harvester float silently, hidden amidst the world's clouds. The planet is a Jovian world (page 58).

unidentified_megastructure_scale_type_3.summary: Use this oracle to determine the size of the megastructure in the sector it inhabits.

trouble_in_the_megastructure.summary: Use this set of oracles to detail your exploration into the depths of a megastructure.

construct_ultra_scale_no_megastructures.summary: Reference the No Megastructures column if you are not using the content from Chapter 4.

gigafoundries_stellar_hyperforge_known_p.name: Gigafoundries Stellar Hyperforge Known Product
gigafoundries_stellar_hyperforge_known_p.summary: When you explore a stellar hyperforge and find something of value that was produced in or delivered to the foundry, use the oracles below. If you are familiar with the precursor technology, use the Known Product table; otherwise, roll on the Unknown Product table. Alternatively, if you know enough about the precursors, you may use both tables to envision an item more specifically.

megastructure_derelict_zones.name: Megastructure Derelict Zones
megastructure_derelict_zones.summary: When prompted to roll for the derelict zone of a megastructure, use this oracle as an extension of the Derelict Zones table on page 351 of the Starforged rulebook.

gigafoundries_stellar_hyperforge_unknown.name: Gigafoundries Stellar Hyperforge Unknown Product
gigafoundries_stellar_hyperforge_unknown.summary: When you explore a stellar hyperforge and find something of value that was produced in or delivered to the foundry, use the oracles below. If you are familiar with the precursor technology, use the Known Product table; otherwise, roll on the Unknown Product table. Alternatively, if you know enough about the precursors, you may use both tables to envision an item more specifically.

unidentified_megastructure_purpose.name: Unidentified Megastructure Purpose
unidentified_megastructure_purpose.summary:
Megastructures are massive alien vaults built to fulfill a particular function. Coming to a definitive conclusion about their purpose requires undertaking an arduous, intense expedition.

When you explore an unidentified megastructure, you may use this oracle to reveal the megastructure function at an appropriate point in your survey, either due to the completion of your expedition or a because your narrative framing would naturally lead you to a revelation regarding the nature of the site.

rows.text: Protection of precious technology or artifacts

stellar_object.name: Stellar Object
stellar_object.summary:
Use this table oracle to define the star at the center of the solar system. Reroll the "Artificial star constructed by a long-dead civilization" result if your precursors

Technological Scale truth on page 94 is that they were type 1 or 2.

rows.text: Neutron star surrounded by intense magnetic fields
Unstable star showing signs of impending supernova
Two stars in close orbit connected by fiery tendrils of energy
Hypergiant star generating turbulent solar winds
Artificial star constructed by a long-dead civilization
Young star incubating in a molecular cloud
Corrupted star radiating with unnatural light
White dwarf shining with spectral light

megastructure_class_type_1_megastructure.name: Megastructure Class - Type 1 (Megastructure / Presumed Purpose / Scale / Stellar Object)
megastructure_class_type_1_megastructure.summary: Use this oracle to identify the type of a megastructure. Reference the column that corresponds to the Technological Scale truth previously established on page 87. The Presumed Purpose hints as to what humanity understands to be the function of the wonder, the Scale defines its size, and the Stellar Object indicates whether the megastructure needs a star or black hole to be present.

rows.text: Unidentified Megastructure / Unknown / Planetary or sub / --

megastructure_class_type_3_megastructure.name: Megastructure Class - Type 3 (Megastructure / Presumed Purpose / Scale / Stellar Object)
megastructure_class_type_3_megastructure.summary: Use this oracle to identify the type of a megastructure. The Presumed Purpose hints as to what humanity understands to be the function of the wonder, the Scale defines its size, and the Stellar Object indicates whether the megastructure needs a star or black hole to be present.

rows.text: Unidentified Megastructure / Unknown / Planetary or sub / --
Accretion Macrocollector / Mining / Stellar / Black  hole
Kugelblitz Silo / Industry / Stellar / Black  hole
Penrose Sphere / Industry / Military  Stellar / Black  hole
Scarred by vast tears or impacts
Glimpses of shadows on the move

Partially constructed / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the terraformer hub, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Jovian World', "Karst World", "Tidally-locked World", and "Shattered World" Planetary Class results.

Operational / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the terraformer hub, do not use the Planetary Class oracle. Instead, use the Altered Planetary Class oracle. When you explore the sanctum of the megastructure, you may attempt to use its systems to rapidly alter a small region of the world. If you do, introduce the features of another planetary class.
Non-functional or offline / Roll on Non-functional table below

Dysfunctional / As operational, but roll >Altered Planetary Class twice (next page). The second result is the original class. Additionally, the planet has powerful earthquakes and violent weather events.

Destroyed / Determine how the terraformer hub affects its world by rolling on the Destroyed oracle. Additionally, the area surrounding the megastructure is a grim wreckage. When you explore this area, envision the features of a grave world (page 54).

Defensive mechanism / Trigger signals; counter-assault preparations / The machines strike!
Energy overload / Electricity arcs; remarkable fluctuations in power / Energy threatens you from all sides!
Guarding keepers / Signs of being under surveillance; sounds of mechanical motility / A force of keepers defend the city!

Transforming pathways / Surroundings being altered; reconfigured routes / You get lost!
Urban fire / Encompassing and intense heat; obfuscating smoke / Fire causes destruction!
Urban flood / Surging currents; inundated spaces / The pathway is engulfed!

Use the following tables to determine the composition of the vessel of the gigatransporter. In addition to these, you may use the Shape oracle on page 102 to further detail it.

If the gigatransporter is a space elevator, Ask the Oracle (small chance) if it has an energy-based beam as a way of transfer instead of the traditional vessel. An energy-based beam does not feature Vessel Levels or Travel Duration, as the beam extends between the surface and orbital stations and provides near-instantaneous travel.

anomaly_effect_backlash.name: Anomaly Effect - Backlash
anomaly_effect_backlash.summary:
Use this table to determine the effect of an aberrations or entities' core zone, or the anomalous backlash experienced when meddling with alien objects or forbidden magic.

The Anomaly Backlash table can also be used when determining the infrequent, though especially powerful, capabilities of aberrations or entities.

rows.text: Corrupts or infects devices or computers
Decays or weakens surrounding terrain or structures
Drains energy from equipment or devices
Generates tendrils of energy that slither or grasp
Nullifies or consumes all light or sound
Nullifies or destroys equipment or devices
Opens a path to another location
Reveals glimpses of the distant past
Reveals glimpses of the far future
Reverses time by a few moments or minutes
Summons or manifests an ancient being or intelligence

sentry_array_when_did_the_communications.name: Sentry Array - When Did the Communications Occur?
sentry_array_when_did_the_communications.summary: While you may use the megastructure to access any presently occurring communications, you may wish to access its vast archive of those that have occurred previously. harvesting_platforms_scale_few.name: Harvesting Platforms Scale - Few

Maintain this result for any other harvester platform encountered in the same solar system or sector. You may use the Planetary Size Specifications table from Chapter 3 to help you envision the Platform Scale result.

sentry_array_what_form_did_the_communica.name: Sentry Array - What Form Did the Communications Take?
sentry_array_what_form_did_the_communica.summary: You may wish to determine what type of communication was intercepted and recorded by using the table below. After getting the result, Ask the Oracle (50/50) if the form of communication was made by one individual or shows more than one participant. These oracle results may be interpreted as one or multiple of the same type.

Knucklebones, pyramids, and cubes might be grouped with others. If the shape is determined to be any of these, roll >Array Quantity to determine the amount of arrays in the habitat cluster. Then, for each additional array, roll on this table again and reroll the "Rungworld, "Sphere", and "Topopolis" results.

rows.text: Knucklebone / Six-pointed star composed of six cylinders
Pyramid / Tetrahedron composed of six cylinders
Cube / Hexahedron composed of twelve cylinders
Rungworld / Ladder-like ring composed of hundreds of cylinders
Sphere / Geodesic polyhedron composed of thousands of cylinders
Topopolis / Looping ring or torus knot composed of countless cylinders

encountering_a_construct.name: Encountering A Construct
encountering_a_construct.summary:
When you are forced to face a construct in a high-stakes, action-oriented conflict and need to determine its rank, follow these guidelines:

  * If you encounter a construct outside a megastructure, roll or pick from the table below.
  * If you encounter a construct within a megastructure, follow the Encounters Rank guideline provided in Chapter 5 on page 99.

rows.text: Troublesome / A construct of minimal capability or meager destructive potential
Dangerous / A construct of middling capability or limited destructive potential
Formidable / A construct of advanced capability or great destructive potential
Extreme / A construct of incredible capability or immense destructive potential
Epic / A construct of unrivaled capability or unparalleled destructive potential

rows.text: Partially constructed / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the megastructure, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Furnace World, "Jovian  World", and "Shattered World" Planetary Class results.

Operational /  When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the megastructure, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Furnace World", "Jovian "World", "Shattered World", "Tainted World" Planetary Class results. Then, roll >Altered Atmosphere and >Altered Life (next page) and treat these as a direct result of changes made to the world by the ecopoiesis array.

Non-functional  or offline / When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the megastructure, reroll the "Anomalous World", "Furnace World", "Jovian World", "Shattered World" Planetary Class results. Making the ecopoiesis array functional will have an effect on the atmosphere; modify the Atmosphere oracle result to be more habitable, then shift the Life oracle result to be scarce or extinct, as much of indigenous flora and fauna might not have evolved to tolerate the new atmosphere.

Dysfunctional / As operational, but the world is wracked by powerful and extreme weather events. When you envision them, take inspiration from weather-based oracles results or base them on the planetary class.

Destroyed / As a result of the array's destruction, all of its stored gases and biomolecules were released simultaneously into the atmosphere, transforming the planet into a furnace world (corrosive atmosphere, extinct life, mono biome: hothouse; page 52). These environments will be wracked by extreme weather events. For these, you may take inspiration from weather-based oracle results or base them on the planetary class.

rows.text: The megastructure's orbital position is such that it is now illuminating the dark side of the planet. The world has the additional feature of being in perpetual daylight.
The megastructure is refracting a significant amount of additional sunlight toward the world's daylight side, resulting in extreme temperatures.
The megastructure's orbital position is such that it is now actively blocking and refracting light away from the world. The planet is an ice world in perpetual darkness.
Partially constructed / While parts of the lunar speculorefractor were constructed, not enough were built to redirect the light required to alter the world. The host planet is an ice world (page 56).

Operational /  When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the lunar speculorefractor, use the Lunar Speculorefractor Planetary Class oracle instead of the Planetary Class oracle. The world has the additional feature of auroras.

Non-functional or offline / The megastructure is not refracting enough light to adequately warm its planet, an ice world (page 56). Making the lunar speculorefractor functional will swiftly warm the planet by rapidly melting it into an ocean world (monobiome: hycean; page 70).
Dysfunctional / As above, but the lunar speculorefractor affects its host world. Roll on the Lunar Speculorefractor Planetary Class oracle
Destroyed / The megastructure and the moon that formed much of it have their remains orbiting their host planet, an ice world surrounded by debris fields (page 56).

moon_density.name: Moon Density

rows.text: The terravore's beam is significantly undercharged and is only affecting an isolated area of the planet. When you roll [Planet](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/planet/class) to generate the features of the world that hosts the terravore, reroll the "Furnace World", "Shattered World", and "Jovian World" Planetary Class results.
